summary: Apple Inc. designs, manufactures, and markets smartphones, personal computers, tablets, wearables, and accessories worldwide. The company offers iPhone, a line of smartphones; Mac, a line of personal computers; iPad, a line of multi-purpose tablets; and wearables, home, and accessories comprising Ai. Apple has recently announced that chief operating officer Jeff Williams will transition out of his role, though he will be staying with the company until his retirement.

Alphabet Inc. offers various products and platforms in the United States, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, the Asia-Pacific, Canada, and Latin America. It operates through Google Services, Google Cloud, and Other Bets segments. Meta has reportedly poached a top artificial intelligence (AI) engineer from Apple, which may impact Alphabet's position in the AI race.

Microsoft Corporation develops and supports software, services, devices and solutions worldwide. The Productivity and Business Processes segment offers office, exchange, SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, office 365 Security and Compliance, Microsoft viva, and Microsoft 365 copilot; and office consumer services. Goldman Sachs and Bank of America have lifted their S&P 500 targets, citing Federal Reserve rate cuts, bond weakness, and investors' willingness to look past near-term challenges.

Meta Platforms, Inc. engages in the development of products that enable people to connect and share with friends and family through mobile devices, personal computers, virtual reality and mixed reality headsets, augmented reality, and wearables worldwide. Meta has reportedly poached a top artificial intelligence (AI) engineer from Apple, which may impact its position in the AI race.

Tesla, Inc. designs, develops, manufactures, leases, and sells electric vehicles, and energy generation and storage systems in the United States, China, and internationally. Elon Musk has announced plans to launch a new "America Party," which may impact the company's stock performance.

NVIDIA Corporation, a computing infrastructure company, provides graphics and compute and networking solutions in the United States, Singapore, Taiwan, China, Hong Kong, and internationally. Goldman Sachs and Bank of America have lifted their S&P 500 targets, citing Federal Reserve rate cuts, bond weakness, and investors' willingness to look past near-term challenges.

Amazon.com, Inc. engages in the retail sale of consumer products, advertising, and subscriptions service through online and physical stores in North America and internationally. Walmart is trying to outpace Amazon with its "Walmart Deals Week," a six-day savings event.

Netflix, Inc. provides entertainment services. Goldman Sachs has increased the price target for Netflix to $1,140.00 from $1,000.00, with an unchanged Neutral rating ahead of its upcoming Q2 2025 earnings.
